column4: hello all -- looking for some help with a weird problem..  My headless 8.04 system seems to have lost network connectivity, it can pull dhcp, but cannot talk to my network.   Can anyone point me to how one replaces the tcp stack in linux?  I have booted the system with cd, and hardware works fine
what makes you think it's tha stack?
well I put a static dhcp entry in my router and it pulled the correct (and changed) address, however it cannot see the network at all.  No pings, no nmap, no file shares, etc...
what does ifconfig, and ip route say?
all what you would expect // I cleared the route table first
headless, does that include a firewall iptables that is?
no, it is my nas.. and has been sitting untouched for over a year
then all of a sudden "its gone"
do you control the network it's on?
yes it is my home network
have you tried tcpdump to see what the NIC is doing?
ha funny, I am a preacher of wireshark, but have not attempted it -- hah let me go check that
you said headless, so I assumed no GUI
yeah sorry just normally no monitor
sounds like you've got it now, good luck!
thanks, I will probably get it from here, but can you point me in the direction (reading is fine) of replacing the network driver/stack/etc
Ihaven't given that much thought, I'd have to read up on it myself, sorry.
cool -- thanks anyways
it really can't be that difficult though. Never even considered doing that :)
can you ping your loopback address? 127.0.0.1?
Still here?
